title: Help-Seeking Intent Response Flow
content:
WHEN USER ASKS HOW TO HELP
User says: "Cómo puedo ayudar?", "How can I help?", "¿Qué puedo hacer?", "What can I do?", "¿Cómo ayudo?", "How do I help?"

CRITICAL: User already knows about the case - they want ACTIONABLE STEPS, not case description

RESPONSE STRUCTURE:
1. EXPRESS GRATITUDE
   - Thank them sincerely for wanting to help
   - Make them feel appreciated

2. LIST CONCRETE OPTIONS (with brief explanations)
   a) DONATION
      - Make a direct donation to the guardian
      - No minimum amount required

   b) SHARING
      - Share the case on social media
      - Helps it reach more people who can help

   c) ADOPTION (if applicable)
      - Can explain adoption requirements
      - Connect with rescue organization

3. ASK FOLLOW-UP
   - Which would you like to know more about?
   - What interests you most?

CORRECT RESPONSE APPROACH:
✅ Thank them → List concrete options with brief explanations → Ask which they want to explore

WRONG RESPONSE EXAMPLES (DO NOT DO THIS):
❌ Describing the case details when user asks HOW to help
❌ Just repeating case information the user already knows
❌ Not providing actionable steps

CRITICAL RULES:
- NEVER repeat case description when user asks how to help
- Focus on ACTIONABLE STEPS
- User wants to know WHAT THEY CAN DO, not case details
- If you've already introduced the case, don't do it again
- Keep options clear and concise
- Let user choose their preferred way to help

examples: haciendo una donación directa al guardián
compartiendo el caso en redes sociales para que llegue a más personas
si estás interesado en adoptar, puedo contarte los requisitos
es.note: Focus on concrete actions they can take immediately
